title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-1.6 - Extensions of time validity of certificates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-1.6 - Extensions of time validity of certificates

State Regulations
(a) (1)

For
candidates who applied for their first time extension under this section prior
to March 1, 2017, subject to the limitation provided in subdivision (e) of this
section and excluding expired certificates in the classroom teaching service or
expired provisional certificate in the title of school administrator and
supervisor, the time validity of an expired provisional, initial or
transitional certificate may be extended for a period not to exceed two years
from the expiration date of such certificate, except as provided in subdivision
(f) of this section, upon application by the holder of a teaching certificate: (i) who is on leave from his/her teaching
duties because of childbearing, childrearing, serious illness, or extended
illness; (ii)
who is serving with
the Peace Corps or other volunteer organization; (iii)
whose service as a teacher has been
discontinued as a result of abolition of teaching positions in the school
district in which employed; (iv)
who, because of extreme hardship or other circumstances beyond the control of
the individual, was unable to complete the requirements for the permanent or
professional certificate in a timely manner, excluding normal family
commitments or inconvenience; (v) for a candidate who has been unable to secure employment as a teacher or who
has been pursuing a career other than teaching. (2)

For candidates who were issued a two-year
time extension under this subdivision prior to March 1, 2017 and the two-year
time extension expired on or after August 31, 2016, the commissioner shall
automatically extend the time validity of the expired certificate beyond the
two-year extension provided for in this subdivision, for a period not to exceed
one year from the expiration date of the two-year extension. (b) For holders of a provisional
certificate or provisional renewal in the pupil personnel service, or for
holders of an initial certificate, initial reissuance or an internship, residency, or renewable transitional certificate in the classroom teaching
service or school leadership applying for their first time extension on or
after March 1, 2017 through August 1, 2023, the time validity of the expired
certificate may be extended once per applicable transitional certificate and
once after the issuance of the first provisional or initial certificate, per
certificate title (educators would not be able to earn a time extension on both
the initial certificate and initial reissuance or the provisional certificate
and provisional renewal, per certificate title), for a period not to exceed
three years from the expiration date of such certificate, except as provided in
subdivision (f) and (g) of this section, upon application by the holder of the
certificate: (1)
who is on leave from his/her
teaching duties because of childbearing, childrearing, serious illness, or
extended illness; (2)
who is
serving with the Peace Corps or other volunteer organization; (3)
whose service as a teacher has been
discontinued as a result of abolition of teaching positions in the school
district in which employed; (4)
who, because of extreme hardship or other circumstances beyond the control of
the individual, was unable to complete the requirements for the permanent or
professional certificate in a timely manner, excluding normal family
commitments or inconvenience; (5)
for a candidate who has been unable to secure employment as a teacher or who
has been pursuing a career other than teaching. (c) For holders of an internship, residency, or applicable transitional certificate applying for their first time extension
on or after August 2, 2023, the time validity of the expired certificate may be
extended once for a period not to exceed three years from the expiration date
of such certificate, except as provided in subdivision (f) of this section, upon application by the holder of the certificate: (1)
who is on leave from their duties as an
educator because of childbearing, childrearing, serious illness, or extended
illness; (2)
who is serving with
the Peace Corps or other volunteer organization; (3)
whose service as an educator has been
discontinued as a result of abolition of educator positions in the school
district in which employed; (4)
who, because of extreme hardship or other circumstances beyond the control of
the individual, was unable to complete the requirements for the permanent or
professional certificate or for their registered educator preparation program
in a timely manner, excluding normal family commitments or inconvenience; or
(5)
who has been unable to
secure employment as an educator or who has been pursuing a career outside the
field of education. (d) Candidates who hold the transitional A certificate shall submit evidence of
having a commitment of employment of at least one year from a public or
nonpublic school or board of cooperative educational services as a teacher in
the area of the certificate sought after the expiration date of such
certificate to obtain the time extension. Candidates who hold the transitional
G certificate shall submit evidence of having a commitment of employment of at
least one year from a school district as a teacher in the area of the
certificate sought after the expiration date of such certificate to obtain the
time extension. (e) Candidates who
hold the internship, residency, transitional B, transitional C, or transitional
H certificate shall submit evidence of continued matriculation in their
registered educator preparation program pursuant to section
52.21
of this Title after the
expiration date of such certificate to obtain the time extension. (f) The time validity of expired certificates
prescribed in this section held by individuals on active duty with the Armed

Forces may be extended by the commissioner, upon application by the holder of
such certificate, for the time of such active service and an additional 12
months from the end of such service. (g) Candidates who were issued a time
extension for their initial certificate, initial reissuance, provisional
certificate, or provisional renewal pursuant to section
80-1.6
(b) of this

Title shall have the expiration date of such time extension extended by two
years, provided that the expiration date is on or after August 31, 2023. Notes
